bibl.title: Papyrology and the Utilization of Coptic Sources.

series.title: Islamic History and Civilization. Studies and Texts.

bibl.title: Papyrology and the History of Early Islamic Egypt
bibl.author: CLACKSON, Sarah J.

bibl.note: A preliminary version of this paper was delivered at the conference "Encounters with Ancient Egypt", held at the Institute of Archaeology, University College London, 15-18 December 2000. - 1. 'Greeks' or 'Copts'? - 2. Coptic-Greek bilingual archives [The archive of Apa John the anchorite; - The archive of Dioscorus of Aphrodito; - The Patermouthis archive]. - 3. The compartmentalization of scholarship. - 4. 'Coptic Egypt' and the 'Coptic problem'. - 5. Integrating Coptic sources. - Bibliography.
